channel.title: Cross Compilation on Skycoin Updates
channel.description: Recent content in Cross Compilation on Skycoin Updates

item.title: Development Update #95
item.description: Cross Compilation To cross compile skycoin, do: Install Gox: go get https://github.com/mitchellh/gox gox -build-toolchain Compile: cd $GOPATH/src/github.com/skycoin/skycoin $G = skycoin-0.3 gox -output=“$HOME/builds/$G-{{.OS}}-{{.Arch}}/$G/address_gen” ./address_gen/ gox -output=“$HOME/builds/$G-{{.OS}}-{{.Arch}}/$G/skycoin” ./skycoin/ It will even output NaCl (native client) for ARM. - native client is an execution sandbox by Google for memory safety and running applications in the browser and phone - it abstracts the networking and directory access - it is likely next standard for Android apps and replacement for flash - there is portable native client, which is like LLVM IR for native client

item.title: Development Update #94
item.description: Cross Compilation: Cross compilation is now working flawlessly! We have builds for Windows, OSX, Linux, BSD, Plan9, Arm, NaCL. It is completely automated. Deterministic Builds: Deterministic builds and pulling all the dependencies inside of the library will be done by about Go 1.6! Deterministic builds, means that if two people compile the source, they will receive binary identical outputs. This means that the binaries cannot be back doored and can be verified.
